text: Psalm 104
Praise to Yahweh for His Creation and Providence
Bless Yahweh, O my soul.
O Yahweh my God, you are very great.
You clothe yourself \add with\add* splendor and majesty,
\add you\add* who cover \add yourself\add* with light as \add with\add* a garment,
who stretch out \add the\add* heavens like a tent curtain,
the one who sets beams in the waters \add for\add* his upper chambers,
who makes clouds his chariot,
who rides\f + \fr 104:3 \ft Hebrew “goes” \f* on \add the\add* wings of \add the\add* wind,
who makes his messengers \add the\add* winds,
his attendants a flame of fire.
He established \add the\add* earth on her foundations,
\add so that\add* it will not be moved forever and ever.
You covered it with \add the\add* deep as with a garment.
\add The\add* waters stood above \add the\add* mountains.
At your rebuke they fled;
at the sound of your thunder they ran off.
They ascended \add the\add* mountains \add and\add* drained though the valleys
to \add the\add* place that you established\f + \fr 104:8 \ft Or “appointed” \f* for them.
You set a boundary that they may not cross over,
\add so that\add* they would not return to cover the earth.
\add You are\add* the one who sends forth springs into the valleys;
they flow between \add the\add* mountains.
They give drink for every beast of \add the\add* field.
\add The\add* wild donkeys ⸤quench⸥\f + \fr 104:11 \ft Literally “break” \f* their thirst.
Along them the birds of the heavens abide.
From among \add the\add* branches they ⸤sing⸥.\f + \fr 104:12 \ft Literally “give voice” \f*
\add You are the one who\add* ⸤waters⸥\f + \fr 104:13 \ft Literally “give drink” \f* \add the\add* mountains
from his upper chambers.
The earth is full\f + \fr 104:13 \ft Or “is sated” \f* with the fruit of your labors:
\add who\add* causes grass to grow for the cattle
and herbs for the service of humankind,
to bring forth food from the earth,
and wine \add that\add* makes glad \add the\add* heart of man,
so that \add their\add* faces shine from oil,
and bread \add that\add* strengthens the heart of man.
The trees of Yahweh drink their fill,
the cedars of Lebanon that he planted,
where birds make \add their\add* nest.
\add The\add* stork \add has\add* its home in \add the\add* fir trees.
The high mountains \add are\add* for the wild goats;
\add the\add* cliffs \add are\add* a refuge for the rock badgers.
He made \add the\add* moon for appointed times;
\add the\add* sun knows its \add time for\add* setting.
You make darkness, and it is night,
when\f + \fr 104:20 \ft Hebrew “in it” \f* all \add the\add* animals of the forest creep about.
The young lions \add are\add* roaring for the prey
and seeking their food from God.
\add When\add* the sun rises, they gather together
and lie down in their dens.
Humankind goes out to its work,
and to its labor until evening.
How many are your works, O Yahweh;
all of them you have done in wisdom.
The earth is full of your creatures.
This \add is\add* the great and ⸤wide⸥\f + \fr 104:25 \ft Literally “broad of hands” \f* sea,
in which \add are\add* moving animals without number,
living things small and great.
There \add the\add* ships sail.
Leviathan \add is there\add* that you formed to play with.\f + \fr 104:26 \ft For this construction meaning “to play with,” see Job 40:29 (Eng: 41:5) \f*
They all wait for you
to give \add them\add* their food ⸤at the proper time⸥.\f + \fr 104:27 \ft Literally “in its season” \f*
You give to them; they gather \add it\add*.
You open your hand, they are filled with \add what is\add* good.
You hide your face, they are terrified.
You take away their breath, they die
and return to their dust.
You send forth your Spirit,\f + \fr 104:30 \ft Or “breath” \f* they are created,
and you renew the face of \add the\add* ground.
May the glory of Yahweh endure forever.
May Yahweh be glad in his works,
the one who looks at the earth and it quakes,
and touches the mountains and they smoke.
I will sing to Yahweh throughout my life;
I will sing praise to my God while ⸤I remain alive⸥.\f + \fr 104:33 \ft Literally “while I am still” \f*
May my meditation be pleasing to him.
I will be glad in Yahweh.
Let sinners perish completely from the earth,
and \add the\add* wicked ⸤not remain alive⸥.\f + \fr 104:35 \ft Literally “they are not still” \f*
Bless Yahweh, O my soul.
Praise Yah.\f + \fr 104:35 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f*
